citeinfo.origin: DNR Division of Fish & Wildlife - Fisheries Unit
citeinfo.title: DNR Hydrography - Lakes with Fish-based IBI Scores (Most Recent IBI Survey)

descript.abstract:
This layer shows the Fish IBI (Index of Biotic Integrity) Scores for MN lakes as calculated by DNR Fisheries. Scores range from 0-100, with higher scores indicating higher biotic integrity. Attributes correspond to the most recent IBI survey for each lake. An IBI (Index of Biotic Integrity) is a biologically-based, multi-metric method for measuring the integrity of aquatic systems. Minnesota DNR Fisheries Research has developed a fish-based lake IBI that incorporates fish data collected by various methods (trap nets, gill nets, shoreline seines, and backpack electrofishing units) into 8-15 metrics in three categories: species richness, community assemblage, and trophic composition (see Section 5: Attributes). Each metric represents an aspect of the biological assemblage structure, function, or other measurable characteristic that changes in some predictable way with increased human-induced stress. Fish IBI scores respond to differences in land use patterns, trophic state, and aquatic vegetation. Validation studies indicate that the fish-based lake IBI scores function as a measure of fish community response to human disturbance across a gradient of lakes. Continuing work by DNR Fisheries will expand the application of this IBI to more lake types and will validate this tool as a viable method for assessing lake impairment as part of Minnesota's 303(d) Impaired Waters assessments. These scores should be considered as 'preliminary' and are subject to change as the IBI tools are further developed and refined. This dataset only includes lakes over 100 acres and within lake classes 20-43, with few exceptions for lakes very close to 100 acres. Additional scores will be added to this dataset annually. For more reference information, see (Section 5: Attributes -- Detailed Citation). Related table: env_ibi_lakes_all_surveys_events_polygon_relate IBI scores for additional years can be found in this table. To access related table records:
  • Open the layer attribute table and select a lake polygon record
  • From the Related Table dropdown (2nd icon on bar just above table), choose table Lake IBI Scores: To IBI Scores - All Surveys
  • The related table will open and the corresponding records for the selected lake will be highlighted.
  • Note: You can also select records from the related table and find the lakes that correspond to those records by reversing the process above (i.e., Choose Related Tables dropdown (2nd icon), choose table Lake IBI Scores: Back to IBI Lakes)
    • You can also access scores from all years by clicking on the lake of interest with the Identify Tool and expanding the related tabular information.
descript.purpose: This layer provides a visual representation of Fish IBI scores to help assess and monitor the condition of Minnesota lakes, and for the purposes of planning, mapping and spatial/temporal analysis. For each lake, the status of the most recent Fish IBI score is displayed by color; scores from previous years can be accessed through the related table (see tips above).

timeperd.current: Re-delineations and edits are frequent and occur as needed. See the attributes DELINEATON_DATE and DELINEATION_SRC for date and source of each polygon. See CONTENT_DATE for last date of attribute updates.
Fish IBI scores are updated through 2011.

theme.themekey: Hydrography, Water, Lakes, Inland Waters, IBI, Index of Biotic Integrity, metrics, clean water, WRAPS

citeinfo.title: DNR Lakes and Open Water

dataqual.complete: Data exist statewide, excluding lake classes 1-19 in far northeastern MN. Lakes < 100 acres are also excluded.

horizpa.horizpar: Polygons have been improved by on-screen digitizing over DOQ and FSA imagery.

procstep.procdesc: The lake polygons are derived from the Open Water feature class of the DNR Hydrography SDE Dataset. See metadata for DNR Water Features for more detail.

attr.attrdef: Unique GIS record number of waterbody features in DNR Hydrography SDE - Open Water Features

A unique Fisheries Waterbody ID for joining/linking polygons to DNR Fisheries Lake Survey DB (Oracle). FW_IDs are assigned based on how the waterbody is managed by DNR Fisheries (i.e., an FW_ID may correspond to an entire basin '00' or to a specific sub-basin '01','02',etc.

edom.edomvd: A valid Fisheries Waterbody ID
A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing an alternate representation of a basin (implemented in SDE Dataset only)
A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing a non-MN portion of a border water

attr.attrdef: Waterbody ID per DNR Ecological and Water Resources (EWR) Division's LAKESDB database; the DOWLKNUM may end in"00" (entire basin) or "01","02", etc. (sub-basin)
Public Water (Lake) Name per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
Identifies whether basin is a sub-basin of a larger complex of basins

edom.edomvd: Yes, is a sub-basin; DOWLKNUM usually ends in '01', '02, '03, etc.
No, is not a sub-basin; DOWLKNUM usually ends in '01', '02, '03, etc.

attr.attrdef: Hydrologic feature type; based on original USCLASS attribute from USGS 100K DLG dataset; some polygons have been reclassified to better indicate their current hydrologic state
Lake Class per DNR Fisheries Investigational Report #417 - Schupp 1992 http://files.dnr.state.mn.us/publications/fisheries/investigational_reports/417.pdf
Surface area of waterbody in acres
Perimeter of shoreline in miles (includes island shoreline)
UTM Easting (X) of waterbody center
UTM Northing (Y) of waterbody center
County Name
DNR Administrative Region

Northeast Region (Grand Rapids)
Central Region (St. Paul)
Southern Region (New Ulm)

attr.attrdef: A unique ID for each IBI survey (matches original IBI database)
Flag indicating whether an IBI survey is a repeat survey

edom.edomvd: IBI survey is not a repeat survey (is initial survey)
IBI survey is a repeat survey (is not an initial survey)

attr.attrdef: Source of IBI Survey (DNR Unit that performed the survey)

edom.edomvd: DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division
DNR Fisheries Section

attr.attrdef: Year of IBI Survey

edom.edomvd: Note: There were no IBI surveys in 2000, 2004

attr.attrdef: Date of IBI Survey

A total score based on summation of 16 weighted metrics. Higher IBI scores indicate better lake quality (as determined by watershed land use, trophic state and aquatic vegetation). Lake characteristics associated with higher IBI scores are low percent littoral area, high maximum depth, high Secchi depth transparency and high latitude.
Metric Score: Number of Native Species. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Number of Intolerant Species. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Number of Tolerant Species. This metric is (-) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Number of Insectivores. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Number of Omnivores. This metric is (-) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Number of Cyprinids. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Number of Small Benthic Dwellers. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Number of Vegetation Dwellers. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Ratio of Intolerants in Nearshore. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Ratio of Small Benthic Dwellers in Nearshore. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Ratio of Vegetation Dwellers in Nearshore. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Ratio of Insectivore Biomass in Trapnet
Metric Score: Ratio of Omnivore Biomass in Trapnet. This metric is (-) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Ratio of Tolerant Biomass in Trapnet. This metric is (-) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Ratio of Carnivore Biomass in Gillnet. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Metric Score: Presence or absence of intolerant fish species in the Gillnet. This metric is (+) correlated with lake quality.
Number of IBI surveys performed on this lake
Flag denoting whether an IBI survey is the most recent for a lake

edom.edomvd: IBI survey is not the most recent survey
IBI survey is the most recent survey

An * indicates whether the lake has more than one IBI score. In ArcMap, click on a lake with the Identify Tool to access records from all years (related table).
Date the layer-specific attributes were last updated
Indicates which IBI Tool was used to generate a score for the lake, also referred to as Lake Group. The Tool is based on lake class and some are adjusted for lake size.

edom.edomvd: At or Below the Impairment Threshold for the Group
Above the Impairment Threshold for the Group, this also includes lakes within, but above a CI for impairment
Above an Exceptional Threshold for the Group
Mixed Results
Mixed Results

attr.attrdef: Describes any conditions with data quality or quantity, or limitations for use

enttyp.enttypd: related table -- same attributes as above

overview.eaover: env_ibi_lakes_fisheries (feature class attribute table): The first set of attributes (DNR_HYDRO_ID through PUBLISH_DATE) are derived from and consistent with the Open Water feature class of the DNR Hydrography SDE Dataset. See DNR Hydrography - All Water Features The remaining attributes are specific to this layer. This layer shows the most recent IBI score for each lake env_ibi_lakes_all_surveys_events_polygon_relate (related table): Attributes are the same as for the GIS polygon layer, except that the related table shows all IBI scores(all years) for each lake
overview.eadetcit: For more detailed information about the fish-based IBI and IBI metrics, consult the following sources: Bacigalupi, Jacquelyn, 2014. Fish-Based IBI Development for Minnesota Lakes & Use in the Watershed Assessment Process â€“ Status Report. Minnesota Department of Natural Resources Report Contact: Jacquelyn Bacigalupi, MNDNR Lake IBI Coordinator, Jacquelyn.bacigalupi@state.mn.us, 218-833-8613 Drake M. T. and D.L. Pereira, 2002. Development of a Fish-Based Index of Biotic Integrity for Small Inland Lakes in Central Minnesota. North American Journal of Fisheries Management 22:1105-1123. Contact: Melissa Drake, MNDNR Fisheries Research Supervisor, melissa.drake@state.mn.us (651)259-5246 Drake, M., and R. Valley. 2005. Validation and Application of a Fish-based Index of Biotic Integrity for Small Central Minnesota lakes. North American Journal of Fisheries Management 25:1095-1111. Schupp D.H. 1992. An Ecological Classification of Minnesota Lakes with Associated Fish Communities. Minnesota Department of Natural Resources Investigational Report 417: 27pp. http://files.dnr.state.mn.us/publications/fisheries/investigational_reports/417.pdf
